level_1: Behavioral interviews are used to understand how you handle real-life situations at work.
The STAR method helps structure your answers: Situation, Task, Action, Result.
Interviewers want to know about your teamwork, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Practicing STAR stories builds confidence for interviews.
You don’t need fancy stories—honest, clear examples work best.
level_2: STAR answers show how you think and react under pressure.
You’ll learn to pick relevant experiences from school, internships, or projects.
Focus on your specific actions and what you learned.
Practice helps you avoid rambling or missing key points.
Feedback from peers can improve your delivery.
level_3: Advanced preparation involves tailoring STAR stories to the company’s values.
You’ll learn to highlight leadership, conflict resolution, and adaptability.
Practice answering follow-up questions and handling curveballs.
Use quantifiable results to strengthen your stories.
Mock interviews simulate real pressure and help refine your approach.
level_4: Experts coach others on STAR techniques and interview strategy.
